author: innocentnor
title: Opportunity Summit
description: Tertiary students in Ghana remain unware of the potential and opportunities of blockchain technology. Therefore, how can we educate and onboard them into the Cardano ecosystem?

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is addressing the objectives of the challenge to scale up, create awareness and adoption of cardano in Africa. With a clear target group of tertiary students, they are the young elites and very curious to learn, embrace and participate in new ideas that has the potential create opportunities for them. The tertiary institutions are where computer science and IT are taught and this could be possible to onboard developers, cryptocurrency analysts, proposers, stakcepool operators. 

The proposal has made it clear to educate tertiary students through collaboration and partnerships to organize a mammoth gathering to onboard into the catalyst ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has the experience to mobilize students and have consistently done that. With this experience the team would be able to put together this events successfully. The team lead is also familiar with catalyst activities and knows how important education programs are to the community for on boarding, adoption and development of Dapps on the cardano blockchain. 
The team has demonstrated and have put together a working plan with schedules that are detailed and simplified for implementation. The timelines have the details of each activity for before, during and after the event to deepen the impact of the outreach. 

The budget is very simple and detailed, showing clear disbursement of funds for a successful implementation of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has KPIs that are measurable to evaluate the progress and success of the proposal. These metrics as shown with outcomes including 150 participants and 50 active YouTube followers are realities and achievable. This would make auditing quite simple for the community. The team also made it known that they will work on feedbacks after the first event to improve in the next events and that could mean the events could attract more attendees to learn to expand the catalyst community. The community will be able to audit for success and failure in each event.

f6_assessments.q0: The Republic of Ghana is a country in West Africa. Population 31.07 million people (in 2020). 53.0% of the population (in 2019) uses the internet. However, University students in Ghana are still not aware of the potential and opportunities of Blockchain technology. Therefore, suggest the idea of ​​educating them and bringing them into the Cardano ecosystem? Organize educational events between universities in Ghana. The proposal is good and completely in line with the goal of the challenge. Here, the goal of the proposal is to educate and introduce Ghanaian university students into the Cardano ecosystem, spreading knowledge about Cardano to a wide audience, more specifically Ghanaian university students. I see this as a positive. The proponent, in addition to explaining what needs to be done, provides a lot of detail on what will be done. The proposal introduced, described the project and, most specifically, the Implementation Strategy: The plan was to organize two groups of events, one in person and one online. In addition, the proposed team recognized the main challenges as difficulty in marketing the program to our target audience to allow more people to learn about blockchain technology. Second: the general lack of motivation for students to participate in events can be another challenge. At the same time, along with those challenges, the team has specific solutions to minimize the difficulties that the proposal will face when it is implemented.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal includes a detailed roadmap with a timetable for each milestone. The project timeline is analyzed in 4 phases and post-event... The proposal provided very detailed information about when the project will be implemented: Phase 1: Planning, team & tooling phase - 1 week after funding (September). Phase 2: after 2 weeks of funding (September). Phase 3: Marketing and Advertising - 3 weeks (September to October). Phase 4 (October). Post-event - 1 week. and finally the Second Campus Event – ​​Last Week in November. At the same time, the tasks are arranged and explained in detail. We know what work will be done to complete the project. Along with those jobs are the members who are full of skills, experience and have written presentations about each member. We know their identities, roles and capabilities. However, it would be nice to suggest to provide some specific links so that we can learn more about their background, work history, increase confidence in the team's abilities, for what the team has presented. about them. Finally, the budget. The proposal requires $3,950. This is a pretty low budget for the team's proposal. In my opinion, the team needs more budget so that the proposal can be implemented and completed in a sustainable way. The budgets allocated to each job are explained reasonably and accurately. Overall, we know what will be done, the budget is transparent and the team is skilled and experienced, all of which will be put together to complete the project well.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provides us with a lot of milestones: Number of attendees, students on board, newly created cardano wallet accounts, etc. At the same time, the proposal team also provides many key metrics, making it easy to We can easily, measure the progress of the project. On the other hand, a very positive thing is, Create a cardano social media community (WhatsApp, Telegram and YouTube) with 50 active followers, and will make this report available to cardano social media channels. In addition, the team will also make the report available on official social media channels and the proposed team's online pages. The proposal is new, but from the plan board shows the expertise and active effort of the proposed team. The detailed roadmap according to each milestone helps investors to easily check the successful progress of the project. Besides, the team with professional skills and transparent detailed budget in the proposal strengthens confidence in the success of the project. In other words, it is a good audit ability, providing enough information to monitor the project seriously and continuously.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal matches very well with the goals of the challenge which focuses on mass adoption of cardano in Africa. The idea here is a brilliant one which aims at educating and onboarding tertiary students into the cardano ecosystem. The plan is to organize educational outreach events which will serve as a platform for students to be educated on the opportunities available in the cardano ecosystem,this idea to me ,is a way of creating awareness and drawing more youths in Africa (Ghana) into the cardano community which solves the problem of the challenge. These events will also help youths identify and explore opportunities in the cardano blockchain which in the long run will help curb the unemployment rates in Africa especially in Ghana where graduate unemployment is very high. This proposal has four main goals it hopes to achieve and I believe these goals dialogue very well with the key metrics of the challenge. I stongly believe if this project is funded,at the end of it all,we get to have new members in catalyst as PAs,VPAs,voters and also have students putting their innovative ideas into proposals to seek for funding to solve problems in their various communities in Africa. This project will go a long way to spread cardano in Africa and as such,this proposal addresses the challenge effectively.

f6_assessments.q0:
The aim of the Proposer is to create awareness of the potential and opportunities of blockchain technology across Universities in Ghana, to educate and onboard Tertiary students .
In achieving this goal, the Proposer intended to introduce educational outreach programmes that will provide the platform to educate students communities in Ghana on blockchain technology and to facilitate Onboarding of students. 
This will provide the foundation to scale up growth of Cardano in Africa, making Cardano a formidable force in in the blockchain space in Africa. 
Considering the large population of Universities students in Ghana, with UPSA alone of about 14,000 students, the Proposer intend to partner with Young Africa for Opportunity (YAFO) , a community with vast experience in the Blockchain Ecosystem to introduce quarterly programme dubbed, Opportunity summit , aiming to enable young Africans especially, students and entrepreneurs to identify and explore the opportunities available to them in the advent of the adoption of blockchain in various industries.
This programme will again enable Africans to gain much attention, huge potential and significant impact through the adoption of Cardano blockchain. 
Main challenges such as difficulties in  sending messages across to targeted audiences and lack of general incentives for massive participation by students. 
Base on these facts provided, I believe strongly the proposal addresses the Challenge.

Detailed profiles of the two member Team (Barbra Ofosu & Innocent Norvinu) to bring to the success of the project are stated showcasing their level of knowledge and experiences. Am by this, convince that, the implementation of the proposal is very high.

Information provided denotes to me, transparency and accountability will be demonstrated.

f6_assessments.q0: It is an undeniable fact that Africa presents itself as the next fertile grounds for the growth and expansion of the blockchain technology which Cardano plays an active role in and equally undeniable that a greater percentage of the populace have little knowledge of the power of Blockchain and how it can be harnessed to address the many challenges the continent faces. f6_assessments.q1:
Having onboard the team a member who has already presented a proposal that has been funded, its prudent to say that his experience alongside the other team member would together make the implementation of the proposal feasible. There are also clearly defined timelines for proposal implementation and also stated budgetary allocations.

 However, more light could have been thrown on the handling of the implementation of the previous proposal of the team member who acquired project funding in Fund 8 as this would give more weight to their ability on this proposal. 

Also, the proposal fails to address the budget breakdown of the second phase of implementation as it would definitely require some pockets if expenses even though it is an online session. A further breakdown on how much of the $500 for Team Cost would go into materials, logistics, coordinates, and organization, would have further given clarity on why such items must be funded and as to if their individual costs are viable for funding. 

In all, I neither agree nor disagree that the implementation likelihood has been spelt out enough to make it a success.

f6_assessments.q0: Designing and hosting physical and online venues specially targeted to tertiary and university students might be the very first successful step in order to outreach and spread awareness towards Cardano blockchain technology in Ghanian student communities. Establishing Cardano representatives from the personal events will guarantee the outreach strategy keeps and enhances its growth. The educational asset of this proposal is to highlight. Getting Ghanian students to know basic Cardano and blockchain technology and Catalyst funding opportunities will give them a powerful tool and might inspire them into designing their own proposals and engage them into entrepreneurism. As Ghana suffers from big unempleyment hurdles this kind can help into the development of communities and be a real life changer. Summits and events this proposal aims to fund are certainly lined with Cardano Catalyst needs and challenges and will effectively address them.
f6_assessments.q1: Considering this proposal is the continuation of their already funded and successful proposal in Fund 8 and that team members already know Catalyst dynamics and timelines, it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully. It is to highlight this team engaging with the long-term challenges towards African and Cardano challenges and needs. Having Wada members in their team is a guarantee of their transparency and commitment. Key milestones and timelines are clear and detailed. Budget breakdown is consistent. Having a marketing strategy ensures events will achieve their outreach goal.
f6_assessments.q2: Knowing that this team is already well acquainted with Catalyst dynamics and rules and that they have already set up communication channels with the whole of the community is a guarantee that the auditability process will be easy and simple. Key numbers they presented for a sufficient audition might not be enough to audit the progress and the success of the proposal. It might be also interesting for a correct audition to face the process with some quality feedback surveys and one to one interviews with Ghanian students. In order for the community to get to know Ghanian students' impressions, challenges and needs, this kind of quality data might be much more profitable than just plain numbers. To achieve our outreach strategy as a community we need to address African hurdles in getting to know blockchain technology and how can we overcome them.
